translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

The two official letters from Your Lordship dated the 15th of the current month remain in my possession after having been presented to the government, and to which I may respond that Lieutenant José Antônio de Faria will proceed with what has been done regarding Your Lordship's requisition, Your Lordship Cachoeira, and since he will have a delay of one or two more days, I hope that Your Lordship Trem, and for this reason Your Lordship Rio Pardo is not to bring from there a portion of cloth, which, going to the army, could not advance, which will be applied to the force under your command.

God keep Your Lordship  
Secretary of War Affairs in Caçapava, March 19, 1840.  
Most Illustrious Colonel João Antônio da Silveira.  
Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre
